workflow.workflowConfigDescription: Configure automatic workflow processing rules. When trigger fields are modified, the workflow will be called and results written to output fields.
workflow.noConfigs: No workflow configurations yet. Click 'Add Configuration' to create one.
workflow.triggerSettingsHelp: Define which fields trigger workflow processing when changed.
workflow.triggerModeAll: Trigger when all fields have values
workflow.execTargetEmpty: Execute when target field is empty
workflow.inputMappingHelp: Map table fields to workflow input parameters. The parameter names should match what the workflow expects.
workflow.inputMappingExample: user_input <- Question field: The 'Question' field value will be passed as 'user_input' parameter to the workflow
workflow.workspaceWorkflowDesc: Use workflow configurations defined at workspace level
workflow.customWorkflowDesc: Enter custom workflow API URL, ID and key
workflow.noWorkspaceConfigs: No workflow configurations in workspace. Please create one first or use custom configuration.
workflow.workflowUrlHelper: The API endpoint URL for the workflow service
workflow.workflowIdHelper: The unique identifier of the workflow to execute
workflow.apiKeyHelper: Authentication key for the workflow API
workflow.apiKeyKeepPlaceholder: Leave empty to keep existing key
workflow.apiKeyEditHelper: Leave empty to keep the existing API key, or enter a new one to replace it
workflow.testSuccess: Connection successful! Workflow is working properly.
workflow.selectConfigFirst: Please select a workspace configuration first
workflow.testInputHelper: Enter JSON format test parameters to test the workflow call
workflow.testInputInvalid: Test input is not valid JSON format
workflow.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete '{name}'? This action cannot be undone.
workflow.workspaceWorkflowDescription: Manage workflow configurations for this workspace. These configurations can be reused by multiple tables.
workflow.workspaceConfigNamePlaceholder: Enter a name for this workflow configuration
workflow.workflowApiSettingsHelp: Configure the connection details for the external workflow API.
workflow.noWorkspaceConfigsHint: Create a workspace-level configuration to reuse across multiple tables.
workflow.deleteWorkspaceConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete '{name}'? Tables using this configuration will need to be updated.

aiAssistant.aiConfigDescription: Configure automatic AI processing rules. When trigger fields are modified, AI will process the content and write results to output fields.
aiAssistant.noConfigs: No AI configurations yet. Click 'Add Configuration' to create one.
aiAssistant.triggerSettingsHelp: Define which fields trigger AI processing when changed. You can select multiple trigger fields and set the trigger mode.
aiAssistant.triggerFieldsTooltip: Select one or more fields as triggers. When these fields change, AI processing will be automatically invoked.
aiAssistant.triggerFieldsHint: Please select at least one trigger field
aiAssistant.triggerModeTooltip: 'Any change': Execute when any trigger field changes; 'All filled': Execute only when all trigger fields have values
aiAssistant.triggerModeAll: Trigger when all fields have values
aiAssistant.triggerModeAnyDesc: Execute AI processing immediately when any trigger field value changes
aiAssistant.triggerModeAllDesc: Execute AI processing only when all trigger fields have values (suitable for scenarios requiring multiple inputs)
aiAssistant.executionConditionHelp: Control when AI executes processing. Can prevent re-processing fields that already have content.
aiAssistant.execTargetEmpty: Execute when target field is empty
aiAssistant.execTargetEmptyDesc: Execute AI only when output field is empty, existing content will not be overwritten
aiAssistant.execAlwaysDesc: Execute AI on every trigger, can choose whether to overwrite existing content
aiAssistant.allowOverwriteHelper: If checked, existing content in target field will be replaced by AI result
aiAssistant.promptSettingsHelp: Write the prompt to send to AI. Use variables to dynamically reference field values from the current row.
aiAssistant.variablesTooltip: Click variable tags to quickly insert into the prompt. Variables will be replaced with actual field values at execution time.
aiAssistant.variablesClickHint: Click variable tags to insert at cursor position in prompt
aiAssistant.promptTemplateTooltip: Use {field_name} syntax to reference field values. AI will automatically replace with actual data from the current row.
aiAssistant.promptPlaceholder: Enter prompt template, use {field_name} to reference field values...
aiAssistant.promptHelper: Use {field_name} to reference field values, supports referencing any field in the table
aiAssistant.outputSettingsHelp: Configure how AI response is written to table fields. Supports single field, multiple fields, and JSON parsing modes.
aiAssistant.outputModeTooltip: Single: AI result writes to one field; Same value: Same result writes to multiple fields; JSON: AI returns JSON, different keys write to different fields
aiAssistant.outputModeSingleDesc: AI's complete response will be written to the selected single field
aiAssistant.outputModeSameDesc: AI's response will be written to all selected fields simultaneously (suitable for displaying same content in multiple places)
aiAssistant.outputModeJsonDesc: AI needs to return JSON format, different key values will be parsed and written to corresponding fields
aiAssistant.noTextFieldsWarning: No text-type fields available. Please create text, long text, or rich text fields in the table first.
aiAssistant.jsonMappingTooltip: Configure which field each JSON key maps to. For example, when AI returns {"title": "...", "summary": "..."}, you can map 'title' to 'Title' field and 'summary' to 'Summary' field.
aiAssistant.jsonMappingExample: AI returns {"title": "Title", "summary": "Summary"} â†’ title maps to 'Title' field, summary maps to 'Summary' field
aiAssistant.workspaceAIDescription: Use AI providers configured in workspace, no need to enter API keys
aiAssistant.customAIDescription: Use custom API URL and key (compatible with OpenAI API format)
aiAssistant.temperatureDescription: Lower values (e.g., 0.2) make output more deterministic and consistent, higher values (e.g., 0.8) make output more random and creative
aiAssistant.noProvidersConfigured: No AI providers configured in workspace. Please configure in workspace settings or switch to custom configuration mode.
aiAssistant.testSuccess: Connection successful! AI is working properly.
aiAssistant.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete '{name}'? This action cannot be undone.
